description: Dive into "Artful Adventures in Bodrum's Galleries" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Artful Adventures in Bodrum's Galleries

places.name: Oasis Sanat Galerisi
places.address: Oasis Mall, Kıbrıs Şehitleri Caddesi, Cumhuriyet, Emin Anter Blv No: 309, 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Windmills Bodrum, a collection of 18th-century stone windmills, offers an enchanting and historical charm to the panoramic landscape of Bodrum. These architectural relics overlook the beautiful Bodrum and Gumbet Bays, strategically positioned to harness coastal winds. Despite their dilapidated state, the windmills provide a picturesque setting between Bodrum and Gumbet, offering breathtaking panoramic views from the mountains.

sources.snippet: For the best vistas of Bodrum, head to the peninsula on the west side of town which is crowned by seven old windmills.
sources.shortName: Dibeklihan Culture & Art Village | Bodrum Peninsula, Türkiye | Attractions

sources.snippet: Perched atop a hill overlooking Bodrum, Gumbet and even the Greek island of Kos, the old windmills are in various states of repair, with some of them well preserved and others looking much the worse for wear. Gleaming in the sun, their whitewashed walls stand out against the blue skies above them and the sun-bleached grasses surrounding them. A wonderfully secluded spot, the windmills themselves may not be much to look at but the view from up on the hillside is breathtaking and is well worth the climb.
sources.shortName: Amazing Things to Do in Bodrum, Turkey (+Map)

places.name: Windmills Bodrum

reviews.text:
The windmills of Bodrum are iconic structures located on the hills surrounding the town, particularly on the Gumbet Bay side. These windmills date back to the 18th century, when they were primarily used for grinding grain, especially wheat and barley. The region's strong and consistent winds made it an ideal location for windmills to harness wind energy for milling.
These are made of local stones. Over time, most of these windmills stopped functioning as mechanized milling methods took over. These are often photographed by tourists, especially at sunset.
there is not much to see here, the mill buildings are partially destroyed, there is a panoramic view of the bay, there are souvenir kiosks and swings, be prepared for strong wind and dust
Cool spot to catch the sunset - a hill with amazing views and these beautiful old windmill ruins that make it feel magical

places.address: Eskiçeşme Mh, Haremtan Sk. No:10, 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye
